designScenario.description: The V H F Radio system is an advanced avionics communication unit designed for seamless two-way voice communication between aircraft and air traffic control. It incorporates dynamic frequency synthesis, advanced redundancy, and real-time signal processing capabilities. This system provides critical command and control integration, ensuring reliable, low-latency communication while meeting stringent modern aviation safety standards.
designScenario.name: V H F Radio

details.description: Ensure robust bidirectional voice communications within the VHF spectrum to support clear and reliable exchanges between cockpit and ATC.
Maintain signal processing latency below 40ms to support near-instantaneous pilot-ATC interactions.
Utilize redundant signal paths, self-monitoring diagnostics, and fail-safe protocols to maintain continuous communication even during component failures.
Ensure integration with existing cockpit management systems and adherence to updated DO-178C/DO-254 certification standards for streamlined maintenance and regulatory compliance.

relationships.description: The VHF Transceiver Unit communicates with the Control and Monitoring Module for signal processing and system diagnostics.
The VHF Transceiver Unit aggregates with the Antenna Interface to convert digital signals into RF transmissions.
The Control and Monitoring Module depends on the Auxiliary Power Supply Unit to provide stable energy for real-time operations.
The Audio Signal Processor is associated with the VHF Transceiver Unit to facilitate optimal modulation and demodulation of voice signals.
The RF Power Amplifier is composed with the Digital Frequency Synthesizer for accurate frequency tuning and adequate power amplification necessary for robust transmission.
